title: Saturday Boredom Busters
text:
October 9,   
It's the opening weekend of the Jaycees Haunted House   Falls. The haunted house opens at 7 p.m. in the Fine Arts Building, across from the Expo Building. The cost is $8, $6 with a food donation to the Food Bank. $16 gets you a fast pass where you can jump to the front of the line. 
"All Children Are Sacred" is the theme of today's Native American Day Parade in Rapid City. The parade begins at 9 a.m. at 2nd Street and Main Avenue and finishes at the Rushmore Plaza Civic Center. Prizes will be awarded to Most Traditional, Most Spirit, Most Humor and Most Colorful floats. 
The Briauna Moulton Memorial features a Poker Run and Bean Bag Tourney at the Upper Cut in Sioux Falls. Registration for both events begins at 11 a.m. A silent auction and raffle ticket sales start at noon. The Upper Cut is located at 2819 East 10th. 
Strawbale Winery in Renner is hosting a Harvest Festival from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. The free festival includes food, wine, live music and pumpkin painting. 
Hope Lutheran Church is hosting a Fall Bazaar from 8:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. The bazaar includes crafts, Christmas gifts, baked goods, plants and Grandma's Attic. Hope Lutheran is located at 1700 S. Cliff. 
Spirits of the Forest is a self-guided hike through Good Earth State Park at Blood Run, southeast of Sioux Falls. The hike starts at 7 p.m. and you can cozy-up by the campfire with a cup of hot cider. Closed-toe shoes, bottled water and bug spray are recommended. 
First United Methodist Church in Aberdeen is hosting a Fall Variety Sale, Silent Auction & Lunch from 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. The proceeds will benefit various mission projects by the church. First United Methodist is located at 502 S. Lincoln St. in Aberdeen. 
Kids can enjoy story-time and an animal encounter at the Bookworms Reading Program at the Great Plains Zoo in Sioux Falls. The program begins at 1 p.m. in the KELOLAND Education Center. It's free with a zoo admission.
